Posts.EditableText: I recently installed Quest. And from what I see it has more functions the the web. When I am trying it it seems to not run. I have uninstalled and installed it. It hasn't run once so far. Any ideas to fix it? Similar problems?
Posts.HTML: I recently installed Quest. And from what I see it has more functions the the web. When I am trying it it seems to not run. I have uninstalled and installed it. It hasn't run once so far. Any ideas to fix it? Similar problems?

Posts.EditableText: If you start Task Manager (right-click the task bar at the bottom of the screen), does it show up in there? Maybe try reinstalling the .net framework from http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download ... x?id=17113
Posts.HTML:
If you start Task Manager (right-click the task bar at the bottom of the screen), does it show up in there?

Maybe try reinstalling the .net framework from http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download ... x?id=17113

Posts.EditableText:
I've been trying to put quest on another computer, and for me, it only fails with game playing mode (as the GUI~Editor works fine). I don't have the exact message with me, but it says something like this:

(event id 59 and event id ?? - forgot. As it shows up in the run -> cmd: eventvwr -> application log)

CefSharp.WinForms.dll could not be located (even though it's installed onto the computer via the quest install wizard), and I can't remember if it said this too or not: "Resolve Partial Assembly failed for Microsoft.VC80.CRT.mui", or if this was just from my googling of the error event id.

As far as I can tell, it's that the computer is missing needed files (or there's a blockage due to comp permissions or policies), like maybe other dll 's that are needed by quest's "CefSharp.WinForms.dll" file. I'm not very techy though, so I don't really understand all this stuff too well or not at all, lol.

Simply downloading the .netframe work, isn't enough, as I did that. I haven't windows-updated the computer, and it's OS is xp, using service pack 2 (it's missing service pack 1 and 3).
